required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Objective and Subjective Changes Induced by Multiple Pinhole Glasses and Single Pinhole Glasses

lead_sponsor.agency: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: Purpose of this study is to compare the ocular functional changes including pupil size, visual acuity, depth of focus, accommodative amplitude, visual field, contrast sensitivity, and stereopsis induced by multiple and single pinhole glasses, in addition, to check reading speed and survey for ocular discomfort after using both pinhole glasses.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Distant visual acuity were measured using Snellen chart (Precision Vision, La Salle, IL, USA) at 4 m.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Pupil size under photopic conditions (85 cd/m2) was measured using a WASCA Analyzer (Carl Zeiss Meditec, Oberkochen, Germany).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Monocular DOF was checked with a 4-m Snellen chart under distance correction without cycloplegics.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Near point of accommodation (NPA) was measured using Donder's push-up method.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Visual field (VF) test was performed with a Humphrey Visual Field Analyzer (Carl Zeiss Meditec, Inc., Dublin, CA, USA) using the 30-2 Swedish interactive threshold algorithm.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Monocular contrast sensitivity test was performed using a CSV-1000E Contrast Testing Instrument (VectorVision, Dayton, OH, USA) at 2.5-m distance under standard brightness (85 cd/m2)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Stereopsis was checked with the Randot Stereotest (Stereo Optical Co., Chicago, IL, USA).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Reading speed was evaluated using the famous Korean traditional fairy tale book. This Korean book was printed black-and-white with 10-font size. The time taken to read designated 10 pages including 3985 letters was recorded, and then reading speed was calculated as letters per second (LPS).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Near visual acuity using Logarithmic Visual Acuity Chart 2000 (Precision Vision, La Salle, IL, USA) at 40 cm.

primary_outcome.measure: Pupil size with the both pinhole glasses (mm)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects performed this examination while wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses with one week apart in random order after baseline study.
primary_outcome.description: Pupil size with the both pinhole glasses using the ruler attached to the lateral rim of the glasses.

arm_group.description: All participants perform all exams under 3 conditions, that is baseline, single pinhole glasses, and multiple pinhole glasses

intervention.intervention_name: Trayner Pinhole Glasses (Trayner Glasses, Ivybridge Devon, U.K.)
intervention.description: Wearing multiple and single pinhole glasses

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Chung-Ang University Hosptial, Chung-Ang University College of Medicine
responsible_party.investigator_title: Department of Ophthalmology, Chung-Ang University Hospital
